fig.label: Figure 1
fig.sd-panel: A. Verification of L-OHP resistance by CCK8 assay and schematic diagram of Ribo-seq in HCT116/L-OHP and HCT116 cells (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM).
B. Average lengths and numbers of identified lncORF, uORF, dORF and mORF by Ribo-seq.
C. Scatter diagram of all kinds of sORF between groups by Ribo-seq.
D. Expression distribution of lncORF in both groups by Ribo-seq.
E. Bioinformatic analysis of ORF score and RRS for each ORF.
F. Comprehensive analysis of differential expression and bioinformatics for identified lncORF. Shown in the heatmap, 56 potential translated lncORFs are related to drug resistance.
G. Length distribution of encoded short peptides.
H. Scatter diagram of lncRNA-seq in HCT116/L-OHP and HCT116 cells.
I. Nine quadrant diagram of translatome and transcriptome correlation analysis.
J. Venn diagram of the lncRNA different in Ribo-seq, high translation-potential by bioinformatics but indifferent in RNA-seq.

fig.label: Figure 2
fig.sd-panel: A. Schematic diagram of sucrose density gradient ultracentrifugation for RNC isolation, and PCR verification of the 12 screened lncRNA in both RNC-RNA and total RNA from two groups of CRC cells, among which the translation level of lnc-AP (marked with a green box) was the most notably dysregulated in both groups of drug-resistant cells (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM, t test). Data information: * for P < 0.05; ** for P < 0.01; NS for no significance.
B. PCR analysis of lnc-AP in serum samples from oxaliplatin-resistant (PD, n = 15) and -sensitive (PR, n = 9) CRC patients (mean±SEM, t test).
C. In the public database lncCAR, high expression level of lnc-AP was correlated with long overall survival in CRC patients.
D. Schematic diagram of two lnc-AP OE plasmids of sORF-Flag fusion and the corresponding initiation codon mutant.

E. PCR and WB analysis of HEK293T cells transfected with either lnc-AP-Flag OE plasmid (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM, Dunnett-t test).
F. PCR and WB analysis of HCT116/L-OHP and SW480/L-OHP cells transfected with either lnc-AP-Flag OE plasmid (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM, Dunnett-t test). Data information: * for P < 0.05; ** for P < 0.01; NS for no significance. Control referred to the corresponding plasmid vector.
G IF detection of pep-AP in HCT116/L-OHP and SW480/L-OHP cells transfected with either lnc-AP-Flag OE plasmid. Scale bar, 10 µm.
H. Schematic diagram of two lnc-AP OE plasmids of HA-sORF fusion and the corresponding initiation codon mutant.
I. WB analysis of HCT116/L-OHP and SW480/L-OHP cells transfected with either HA-lnc-AP OE plasmid.
J. IF detection of pep-AP in HCT116/L-OHP and SW480/L-OHP cells transfected with either HA-lnc-AP OE plasmid. Scale bar, 10 µm.

fig.label: Figure 3
fig.sd-panel: A. Knockdown of lnc-AP, as well as the endogenous pep-AP in HCT116 and SW480 cells (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM, t test). Data information: * for P < 0.05; ** for P < 0.01; NS for no significance. si-NC was the abbreviation of commercial normal control of siRNA.

B. CCK-8 assay of inhibition ratio by L-OHP in two groups of CRC cells with down- or up-regulation of lnc-AP (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM). Data information: * si-NC was the abbreviation of commercial normal control of siRNA.

C. IF detection of H2AFX for DNA damage by L-OHP in two groups of CRC cells with down- or up-regulation of lnc-AP, and nuclei were stained with DAPI (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM, Dunnett-t test).
D. Prediction of potential transcription factors for the source gene of lnc-AP by Match.

E. PCR confirmation of siRNA of the predicted transcription factors in HCT116 and SW480 cells (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM, t test). Data information: * for P < 0.05; ** for P < 0.01; NS for no significance. si-NC was the abbreviation of commercial normal control of siRNA.

F. PCR analysis of effect of the predicted transcription factors on lnc-AP in HCT116 and SW480 cells (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM, Dunnett-t test). Data information: * for P < 0.05; ** for P < 0.01; NS for no significance. si-NC was the abbreviation of commercial normal control of siRNA.

G. Verification of the interaction between CEBPA and the upstream region of AP002387 via ChIP assay followed by PCR (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM, t test). Data information: * for P < 0.05; ** for P < 0.01

H. PCR analysis of lnc-AP attenuation and restoration in HCT116 and SW480 cells (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM, Dunnett-t test). Data information: * for P < 0.05; ** for P < 0.01; NS for no significance. Control referred to the corresponding plasmid vector and si-NC was the abbreviation of commercial normal control of siRNA.
I. WB verification of pep-AP attenuation and restoration in HCT116 cells.

J. CCK-8 assay of inhibition ratio by L-OHP in HCT116 and SW480 cells with lnc-AP/pep-AP attenuation and restoration (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM). Data information: * si-NC was the abbreviation of commercial normal control of siRNA.

fig.label: Figure 4
fig.sd-panel: A. Schematic diagram of Co-IP combined with LC-MS/MS to screen potential proteins interacted with pep-AP.
B. Silver staining of gels for separating proteins by Co-IP in HEK293T cells.

C. GO annotation of molecular function for pep-AP-interacted proteins. Shown in the upper table and the lower chart, most of the proteins were involved in protein binding, of which TALDO1 with transaldolase activity was quite statistically significant (marked with a red box or a red circle).

D. Survival analysis correlated with TALDO1 using TCGA data. Upper: the Kaplan curve of overall survival probability for patients with high or low level of TALDO1. Lower: the expression graph of TALDO1 in patients who were dead or not.
E. WB confirmation of the interaction between pep-AP-Flag and TALDO1 in HEK293T, HCT116/L-OHP and SW480/L-OHP cells.
F. IF detection of the colocalization of pep-AP-Flag and TALDO1 in HCT116/L-OHP and SW480/L-OHP cells. Scale bar, 10 µm.
G. WB confirmation of the interaction between HA-pep-AP and TALDO1 in HCT116/L-OHP and SW480/L-OHP cells.
H. IF detection of the colocalization of HA-pep-AP and TALDO1 in HCT116/L-OHP and SW480/L-OHP cells. Scale bar, 10 µm.

fig.label: Figure 5
fig.sd-panel: A. WB analysis of TALDO1 overexpression or knock down in two groups of CRC cells, which was quantified by gray analysis on the right (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM, t test). Data information: * for P < 0.05; ** for P < 0.01. Control referred to the corresponding plasmid vector and si-NC was the abbreviation of commercial normal control of siRNA.

B. Relative NADPH/NADP+ ratio (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM, t test)
C. GSH contents (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM, t test) Data information: * for P < 0.05; ** for P < 0.01. Control referred to the corresponding plasmid vector and si-NC was the abbreviation of commercial normal control of siRNA.

D. Cellular ROS was measured by flow cytometry and shown in both curve and bar charts (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM, t test) Data information: * for P < 0.05; ** for P < 0.01. Control referred to the corresponding plasmid vector and si-NC was the abbreviation of commercial normal control of siRNA.

E. MMP detection. Scale bar, 10 µm.
F. IF detection of H2AFX for DNA damage by L-OHP. Scale bar, 10 µm.

G. CCK-8 assay of the inhibition ratio by L-OHP (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM, t test) with down- or up-regulation of TALDO1 in two groups of CRC cells.
Data information: * for P < 0.05; ** for P < 0.01. Control referred to the corresponding plasmid vector and si-NC was the abbreviation of commercial normal control of siRNA.

fig.label: Figure 6
fig.sd-panel: A. WB analysis of TALDO1 expression
B. WB analysis of phosphorylation at serine residues of the immunoprecipitated TALDO1

C. Relative NADPH/NADP+ ratio (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM, Dunnett-t test)
D. GSH contents (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM, Dunnett-t test) Data information: * for P < 0.05; ** for P < 0.01; NS for no significance. Control referred to the corresponding plasmid vector and si-NC was the abbreviation of commercial normal control of siRNA.

E. Cellular ROS was measured by flow cytometry and shown in both curve (left) and bar (right) charts (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM, Dunnett-t test) Data information: * for P < 0.05; ** for P < 0.01; NS for no significance. Control referred to the corresponding plasmid vector and si-NC was the abbreviation of commercial normal control of siRNA.
F. MMP detection with down- or up-regulation of lnc-AP/pep-AP in two groups of CRC cells. Scale bar, 10 µm.

fig.label: Figure 7
fig.sd-panel: A. WB analysis of PARP, cleaved-PARP, caspase-3 and cleaved-caspase-3 under L-OHP
B. TUNEL of nuclear DNA fragmentation exposed to L-OHP. Scale bar, 20µm.

C. Flow cytometry of the cell apoptosis ratio under L-OHP with down- or up-regulation of lnc-AP/pep-AP in two groups of CRC cells, which was quantified in bar charts on the right (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM, Dunnett-t test). Data information: * for P < 0.05; ** for P < 0.01; NS for no significance. Control referred to the corresponding plasmid vector and si-NC was the abbreviation of commercial normal control of siRNA.
D. lipid-ROS measurement with down- or up-regulation of lnc-AP/pep-AP in HCT116 and HCT116/L-OHP cells.

E. CCK-8 assay of the inhibition ratio by L-OHP with inhibitors of apoptosis Z-VAD-FMK or ferroptosis Fer-1 in HCT116/L-OHP and SW480/L-OHP cells (n = 3, biological replicates, mean±SEM). Data information: * Control referred to the corresponding plasmid vector

fig.label: Figure 8
fig.sd-panel: A. A flow chart depicting the in vivo experimental design.

B. Alterations of tumor volume in different groups with or without pep-AP OE (n = 6, biological replicates, mean±SEM). Data information: * for P < 0.05; ** for P < 0.01; NS for no significance. Control referred to the corresponding plasmid vector.
C. (a) Pictures of the tumors in all groups in B. (b) Further validation of the effect of pep-AP in vivo.
D. Weight of the tumors in C(a) (n = 6, mean±SEM, Dunnett-t test). Data information: * for P < 0.05; ** for P < 0.01; NS for no significance. Control referred to the corresponding plasmid vector.

E. RT-qPCR quantification of lnc-AP within the tumors in C(a) (n = 6, mean±SEM, Dunnett-t test). Data information: * for P < 0.05; ** for P < 0.01; NS for no significance. Control referred to the corresponding plasmid vector.
F WB analysis of pep-AP, TALDO1, PARP, cleaved-PARP and cleaved-caspase-3 within the tumors in C(a).

G. Relative NADPH/NADP+ ratio within the tumors in C(a) (n = 6, mean±SEM, Dunnett-t test).
H. GSH contents within the tumors in C(a) (n = 6, mean±SEM, Dunnett-t test). Data information: * for P < 0.05; ** for P < 0.01; NS for no significance. Control referred to the corresponding plasmid vector.
I. IF detection of pep-AP, TALDO1 and H2AFX, TUNEL of DNA fragmentation and IHC of Ki67 within the tumors in C(a).
J. A proposed mechanistic model in this study.
